captions.text:
This thing is so fast at speed and G-forces
that you have to remember to breath, you have

to remember to hold on, and you have to remember
where you're pointing it. It's absolutely

insane. The new Corvette Z06 is the most powerful
car GM has produced. In a sense a space once

taken up by the ZL1. The performance numbers
are hard to belief but you can take the top

off and order as an automatic. How is that
even possible? Here we have the new Corvette

Z06 looks like fun! And of course we have
gone on and Chevy's gone on about how great

the 8 gear is but they gave us a 7-speed manual
so that's what we'll test. This is stage 2

of 3 aerodynamic kit and these are parts we'll
talk about once I get to the splitter and

this side over here. Down here at the from
this is the splitter but there are actually

2 brakes inlets that lead to the brakes and
let cool air in. All the aerodynamic stuff

here is functional by a large amount. These
2 guys you see here they're not a design choice

they're there to pass a pedestrian safety
standard in Europe that's why they had to

do these little shark's teeth coming out there.
Here's where we get to the meat of the car

this is the ZL7 package of the Z06 that means
there's a bunch of different upgrade performance

parts in the tires and carbon ceramic brakes.
the tires themselves are Michelin Pilot Sport

Cup 2s and they are really, really sticky.
We've used a bit of tread already. Further

back we have these side skirts and this guy
here a cooling feeding duct. These feed the

motor its a combination of a naccaduct and
a ram air effect. At one point there's a nacca

air duct effect and a ram air effect on the
other side. They actually made this in the

wind tunnel and when the engineers saw it
they didn't know what to think of it, but

they tested it and that's why it sits here
the way it does. This is the supercharged

6.2 Liter LT-4 V8 that makes 650 horsepower
and 650 pound feet of torque. Why is this

engine incredible? Well the power and torque
also it's a pushrod engine that has activation

its amazing technology. Wondering why aren't
they doing a quad cab engine and such? IF

you look at the engine and see that having
the cam in the block you don't have a bunch

of crazy valve train to get in the way of
other things. It means keeping a low roofline.

Having a compact engine means a low hoodline
that means great visibility. The advantages

are numorous and the engine is rich. Interestingly
Chevy originally wanted to do a big displacement

high rev engine that won emissions targets
but this is what they went with and it looks

pretty awesome. The hardware looks great.
Next we'll see it on the test track. Launch

control makes applying the 650 pound feet
on tap more consistent but also slower. Find

the right amount of tread and you'll reach
60 in 3.2 seconds and the quarter mile in

11.3 seconds at 126.2 miles per hour. Peak
stopping distance of 91 feet from 60 miles

per hour is low as the last ZR1 and as our
test dates stay under 100 feet. The ZL6 22

second lap time around the figure 8 is the
fastest we've ever recorded from a production

car that wasn't the Porsche 918. The 918 is
better. The 1.16 average lateral acceleration

is the greatest we've seen from something
that wasn't a race car. It felt like driving

a tilt o whirl. The car is very fast! Listen
to that. And this is amazing. I want to call

it a Z-51 because it reminds me of it in the
good ways. I remember the first time I drove

the Z-51 I got in the car, put it in gear
and wanted to void my bowels! Ridiculous and

scary and everything. So much fun to lay on
the throttle but what impresses me most is

G-forces when you press on the gas back in
the seat or the sides when you go around a

corner. All you need to do is think of the
Z-51 and turn the dial up more. It drives

similar to the Z-51 only we're going so much
more faster. One of the traits from the Z-51

was fear it was a sketchy car to drive quickly
you felt fear brining it up to speed because

it was so fast. This doesn't have that fear
this doesn't give you worry. You can jump

in and instead of feeling threatened you can
enjoy it more instead. First impressions of

this thing are pretty awesome this offers
a performance value. So far not many down

sides. Incredible performance for not a ton
of money. It's kind of nuts. Pro Racer Randy

Pobst joined us to do hot laps but of course
he got it the fastest way you can get it with

a Stage 3 Aero package and the automatic.
After driving it hard you get out of the Z06

quiet and wide eyed. There's a level of performance
few cars can attain and those that do have

way high price tags. This Corvette just over
$80,000 to start and about $100,000 as tested

and with that price comes a clear message:
bring it on, world! I'm kind of hungry so

I'll buy a fast food chain. You know? I kind
of feel like buying an RC airplane so I'll

get an F18 hornet. It's great but my god!
It's so much! Oh my god, and the performance
is off the charts.

title: 2015 Corvette Z06: GTR Beware! The High Performance Bargain Benchmark is Back! - Ignition Ep. 119
